title: Changing the Confidence Level or Sample Size
body: Suppose scores on exams in statistics are normally distributed with an unknown population mean and a population standard deviation of three points. A random sample of $$36$$ scores is taken and gives a sample mean (sample mean score) of $$68$$. The EBM is $$0.8225$$.
lesson: 7.1 The process of estimation. Introduction to Confidence Intervals
